rtk.title: Heisig RTK
rtk.intro1: This program filters out kanjis from a text and provides them with on/kun readings and various other information from KANJIDIC2. If the kanji is enlisted in James W. Heisig's RTK1 book, its keyword and frame numbers are included from the book. 6395 kanjis have stroke diagrams, provided by KanjiVG.
rtk.intro2: What differs this from traditional kanji dictionaries is the ability to analyze multiple kanjis at once and its RTK integration. Insufficient contextual information can be counted as a disadvantage. For a more sizable dictionary, you might want to take a look at jisho.org.
rtk.query: Sentence, en/et keyword, frame no. or primitive
